intro: Monoon merrillii, commonly known as the Malayan moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features include a slender stem, alternate leaves, and yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil.
